definition: guqin 古琴[gu3 qin2] (a type of zither)/musical instrument in general

home/family/(polite) my (sister, uncle etc)/classifier for families or businesses/refers to the philosophical schools of pre-Han China/noun suffix for a specialist in some activity, such as a musician or revolutionary, corresponding to English -ist, -er, -ary or -ian/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: Generally speaking , the most pianists all accepted the professional training in the year one.
sentences.chinese: 大凡鋼琴家都在早年接受過專業訓練。

sentences.english: The pianist made a conquest of every audience for which she played.
sentences.chinese: 這位鋼琴家以她的演奏征服了每一位聽衆。

sentences.english: One of my all-time favorite jazz pianists is Thelonious Monk.
sentences.chinese: 瑟隆尼亞斯孟克是我其中一個最愛的爵士樂鋼琴家。

sentences.english: The pianist improvised an accompaniment to the song.
sentences.chinese: 那位鋼琴家爲那首歌即席伴奏。
美籍匈牙利鋼琴家，教育家。

sentences.english: Who are your favorite pianists? —Paul Chow, Toronto
He is the despair of all other pianists.
sentences.chinese: 他使其他所有的鋼琴家都感到失望。

sentences.english: Joan and Jane are sisters. The former is a pianist; the latter is a singer.
sentences.chinese: 瓊和簡是姐妹，前者是鋼琴家，後者是歌手。

sentences.english: The audience clapped the famous pianist heartily.
sentences.chinese: 觀衆向這位著名的鋼琴家熱情地鼓掌。

sentences.english: Millions of pianists in China were vying for fame.
sentences.chinese: 中國有成千上萬的鋼琴家爲出人頭第而拼掙。

sentences.english: I have been a struggling piano player for many years.
sentences.chinese: 多年來，我一直是個離鋼琴家很遙遠的鋼琴演奏者。

sentences.english: Minho wants to become a pianist so he always stays late to practice.
sentences.chinese: 珉豪想成爲一個鋼琴家，所以他總是練習得很晚。

sentences.english: The pianist concluded the recital with a Chopin Etude .
sentences.chinese: 這位鋼琴家以一部肖邦練習曲結束了獨奏會。

sentences.english: The soprano and the pianist did not get together very well.
sentences.chinese: 這位女高音和這位鋼琴家配合不太好。

sentences.english: Lang lang was chosen to play in place of that pianist.
sentences.chinese: 朗朗被選去代替那位鋼琴家演奏。

sentences.english: The brilliant pianist has long been held in the good graces of the critics.
sentences.chinese: 這位極富才華的鋼琴家一直受到評論界的青睞。
